q: jobs at Microsoft, with new blood coming in to run the key business units- prompted by Microsoft's misreading of some of the biggest technology trends of recent times, most notably smartphones and tablets. Over the past year we've seen the departure of many of the Microsoft old guard- including chief software architect Ray Ozzie and server and tools chief Bob Muglia- in preparation for the reshuffle. Steve Ballmer has been spearheading this effort and we don't see any change in his commitment to the company he's led for the past 11 years, he added. he said. Zahi Hawass discovered that three "tourist police" who had stayed at the museum throughout the night had caught and bound one of the nine looters who had smashed through the roof. I saw his face, and he looked like an outlaw, Zahi Hawass said. The looters, who Zahi Hawass believes were searching for gold, smashed 13 showcases on the museum's top floor, then entered the famous King Tutankhamun galleries, where they broke several more artifacts

came just before Google announced earnings for its most recent quarter. At$ 8.44 billion, Google's fourth-quarter revenue jumped 26 percent from a year earlier. Profit climbed 29 percent to$ 2.54 billion. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth-- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider Web, Eric Schmidt said in a statement accompanying the results. 2012 Colin Powell says he's uncommitted in 2012- POLITICO Live: Colin Powell says he's uncommitted in 2012 Colin Powell said on Sunday that he was not committed to supporting Barack Obama or any other candidate in 2012 I'm not committed to Barack Obama . I'm not committed to a Republican candidate, Colin Powell said on CNN's "State of the Union "I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates and finally see who the two candidates are who are going for this position."
